messages.messageBody:
Wow, I'd never visited the art page, either, what a great collection
of links.

It also explains the name of the restaurant in Monsters, Inc.,
Harryhausen's : ) - I can always hear Billy Crystal's voice lingering
over the "ow" in Harryhausen's when he says it.

Kelly

messages.subject: Teeny Little Super World
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I hadn t seen your art page before, Sandra. What a coincidence that the kids were showing me, late last night, both the Strongbad as Japanese art and the
messages.messageBody:
-=-I hadn't seen your art page before, Sandra. What a coincidence that
the kids were showing me,
late last night, both the Strongbad as Japanese art and the birth of
trogdor bits on Homestarrunner.-=-

I used to be surprised by coincidences like that but now am more
amused and grateful.

Last weekend on Saturday, Marty and Holly and I were doing a five hour
+ drive, and we listened to an old cassette tape of an LP of Little
Shop of Horrors. The intro goes "On the 23rd day of September..."
and I'm like "HEY! What day is this!?" The kids weren't sure, but
I had the wedding invitation, and there it was... same day.

Somewhere in that happy sing-along hour, Marty asked who sings Audrey
II. I said Levi Stubbs, from the Four Tops, who wasn't usually the
lead singer, but sang "Bernadette."

Time passed, wedding, reception, touristing, swimming pool, and when
we started driving back late the next morning we were too far from
regular radio stations. Marty went "search, search," and found an El
Paso oldies station. The second song they played after we turned it
on was Bernadette, by The Four Tops.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
On Sep 29, 2006, at 5:39 AM, Sandra Dodd wrote:

> http://sandradodd.com/arts
>
> I added some Teeny Little Super Guy info and links to my art page.
> Thanks, Jocelyn, for letting me know some of that was available now.

I hadn't seen your art page before, Sandra. What a coincidence that
the kids were showing me,
late last night, both the Strongbad as Japanese art and the birth of
trogdor bits on Homestarrunner.

Zach (15) who loves Homestarruner was showing those to Zoe (8) who is
an artist. Sweet sibling stuff.


Chris in IA
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/IAUnschoolers/

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Teeny Little Super Guy
messages.msgSnippet: ... The only glitch I see is with the table that contains Tie Dye Temple , Gallery of Tie-Dyed Art and Computer Jigsaw Puzzles . When the screen is
messages.messageBody:
On Sep 29, 2006, at 6:39 AM, Sandra Dodd wrote:

> If anyone's bored and capable and would like to look and see if you
> can figure out why there's a glitch in the html there (if you see
> one, in there being blank space under the teeny little super guy
> table (something in or around the "Two Simple Art Games" title), I'd
> appreciate it.

The only glitch I see is with the table that contains "Tie Dye
Temple", "Gallery of Tie-Dyed Art" and "Computer Jigsaw Puzzles".

When the screen is widened, the "Tie Dye Temple" table moves next to
the table with "Teeny Little Super Guy". And then the "Tie Dye
Temple" table gets confused. I think because it has percentages in it
to tell it how wide to be. When it's below the "Teeny Little Super
Guy" then the 90% for the "Tie Dye Temple" table takes up 90% of the
screen. But when it's next to the "Teeny Little Super Guy" table it
runs off the edge of the screen and gets confused about what it's
supposed to be taking 90% of.

You could make "Tie Dye Temple" table a fixed width. Or put it above
the "Teeny Little Super Guy" table.

I think the only ways to make the "Tie Dye Temple" table stay below
he "Teeny Little Super Guy" table is to put them into a larger table,
or connect the two tables.

Not sure if that all makes sense!

Joyce

messages.subject: Teeny Little Super Guy
messages.msgSnippet: http://sandradodd.com/arts I added some Teeny Little Super Guy info and links to my art page. Thanks, Jocelyn, for letting me know some of that was available
messages.messageBody:
http://sandradodd.com/arts

I added some Teeny Little Super Guy info and links to my art page.
Thanks, Jocelyn, for letting me know some of that was available now.

If anyone's bored and capable and would like to look and see if you
can figure out why there's a glitch in the html there (if you see
one, in there being blank space under the teeny little super guy
table (something in or around the "Two Simple Art Games" title), I'd
appreciate it. It's 4:00ish a.m. and I couldn't sleep, but I'm not
awake enough to find this error, somehow.

Sandra
